alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 6:21AM AKST until January 12 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, and periods of blizzard conditions and freezing rain. Total snow accumulations 8 to 12 inches. Ice accumulation of one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Ice will cover many surfaces. Power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow will develop this afternoon with blizzard conditions possible tonight through Thursday night. Freezing rain is possible after midnight tonight into Thursday.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
